abstract.text: Learn about important changes to Accessibility.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Browse notable changes in
Enhance music with tactile feedback for people who are deaf or hard of hearing by playing Apple-generated haptic tracks along with music tracks. Add the
key to notify the system that your app supports the Music Haptics feature. Specify which song is playing using the

. Music Haptics uses the International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) to choose the correct Music Haptics track to play at the same time. Observe and respond to the status of the haptic track playback using
Open the Settings app to a specific section of Accessibility settings using
Support people’s preference to reduce the blinking animation of the text insertion indicator for custom cursor implementations. Check the value of the preference with
, and observe when people change that preference with
Check if a device uses Assistive Access with
if you need to remove workflows or UI elements that aren’t appropriate in the context of Assistive Access.
Add accessibility custom actions to interactive widgets or custom controls using new accessibility action modifiers such as
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/view/accessibilityaction(named:intent:)-26k7g
Improve the drag-and-drop experience for accessibility clients such as VoiceOver. Define the location of a drag or drop point and a textual description of the kind of drag or drop available using
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/View/accessibilityDragPoint(_:description:)-81e6u
and
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/View/accessibilityDropPoint(_:description:)-65k1c
Specify that your accessibility element behaves as a tab bar using the
accessibility trait with the
modifier. In UIKit, use
Enhance how you structure accessibility labels by appending custom content using
Generate a localized description of a color in a string interpolation by adding
, such as
. Pass that string to any accessibility modifier.
Provide accessibility information conditionally with new modifiers such as
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/swiftui/view/accessibilitylabel(_:isenabled:)-83vyj
Provide a great experience for your app in Assistive Access, an accessibility feature that tailors the iOS and iPadOS experience for people with cognitive disabilities. Adopt
to allow your app’s UI to expand into all the available space above the Back button in Assistive Access.

Personalize your app with Personal Voice, a new feature that lets people record and recreate their voice directly on their iOS and macOS devices. Personal voices appear alongside system voices and are available for Live Speech, a type-to-speak feature that lets a person synthesize speech on the fly. Request access to synthesize speech with personal voices using a new request authorization API in

Detect and mitigate sequences of flashing effects in your video content when the Dim Flashing Lights setting is on. If your app performs custom video drawing instead of using AVFoundation APIs, implement this behavior using
Pause animated images in your app when a person turns off the Animated Images setting on their device. Check the value of this setting using
Send announcement, layout change, screen change, and page scroll accessibility notifications with greater ease in multiplatform apps using the new Swift type
. Make sure people receive the most important information first by specifying a default, low, or high priority for announcements.
Enhance custom accessibility elements by specifying the combination of traits and behaviors that best characterizes the element. Add the new trait
to controls that toggle on and off, and the new action
to content that can zoom in and out.
Configure new direct touch options through
to provide the best experience for elements that support direct touch interactions in your app. Specify the
option to ensure VoiceOver is silent when a person interacts with the direct touch area so your app can provide its own audio feedback. Specify the
option to make the direct touch area require VoiceOver to activate the element before touch passthrough happens.
Simplify how you maintain your UIKit accessibility code with block-based setters for accessibility attributes.
Ensure robust testing of your app’s accessibility experience by performing accessibility audits using
Assign automation elements to expose certain UI elements specifically for the purpose of automation without affecting the accessibility of those elements.

Apple-Intelligence-updates-page-PageImag.alt: A stylistic image of the Apple Intelligence logo.

abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
Learn about important changes to Core Location.
An object that produces synthesized speech from text utterances and enables monitoring or controlling of ongoing speech.
Make your apps accessible to everyone who uses Apple devices.
Types of accessibility notifications that an app can post.
A Boolean value that indicates whether Assistive Access is running.
Opens the Settings app to a specific section of Accessibility settings.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system setting to prefer a nonblinking cursor in editable text fields is on.
A notification that posts when the system setting to prefer a nonblinking cursor in editable text fields changes.
A Boolean value that indicates to the system that your app supports the Music Haptics feature.
A Boolean value that indicates if an iOS or iPadOS app appears as full screen in Assistive Access.
A class that processes a framebuffer object to detect and dim sequences of flashing lights.
A class that reports information about the Music Haptics feature.
The International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) of the Now Playing item.
Prevents touch passthrough with the direct touch area until an assistive technology, such as VoiceOver, has activated the direct touch area through a user action, for example a double tap.

Allows a direct touch area to immediately receive touch events without an assitive technology, such as VoiceOver, speaking. Appropriate for apps that provide direct audio feedback on touch that would conflict with speech feedback.
The accessibility element is a tab bar
The accessibility element is a toggle.
Whether the setting for playing animations in an animated image is on. When this value is false, any presented image that contains animation should not play automatically.
Adds the given traits to the view.

Explicitly set whether this accessibility element is a direct touch area. Direct touch areas passthrough touch events to the app rather than being handled through an assistive technology, such as VoiceOver. The modifier accepts an optional `AccessibilityDirectTouchOptions` option set to customize the functionality of the direct touch area.
Adds a label to the view that describes its contents.
Adds an accessibility zoom action to the view. Actions allow assistive technologies, such as VoiceOver, to interact with the view by invoking the action.
The accessibility element behaves like a tab bar.
A proxy that can launch, monitor, and terminate a test application.

featured.svg.alt: An icon, with a star and a speech bubble around it, representing updates.
